sourceMeaningMnemonic: When a <radical>spirit</radical> <radical>stop</radical>s protecting you, you'll have to go on <kanji>welfare</kanji>. If you can't rely on your family spirit, you'll have to have the help and protection come from somewhere else.
meaningInfo: The next time you see someone on welfare, be nice. Their spirit stopped protecting them, so they need a little more help right now.
readingMnemonic: While on <kanji>welfare</kanji>, you have to do the only job available to you: herding <reading>shee</reading>p (<ja>し</ja>). Sheep can help you out when you're having a rough time. Sheep provide warmth, wool for clothes, and even food, if you wanna get dark about it.
readingInfo: If you've ever been on welfare you probably already know about the sheep.
